poem:
**Ministering Angel of Death**

In the chambers of despair,  
Rachel, swathed in shadow, strides.  
Whispers of doom coil tight,  
Each breath a prophecy, a sigh—  
Dark robes brushing fate's brinks.  
In the Treasury's murk, every  
Gesture echoes a nation's pulse,  
Bruised but defiant, under her  
Unseen hand. Shadows  
Speak, futures unravel.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "As the Prophetess of Doom, Rachel Reeves takes on the role she’s waited for all her life | John Crace Onwards and sideways. Abandon hope all ye who enter here. To get the full surround sound effect of Project Miserable you only have to observe Treasury departmental questions. A place from which few come out alive. Presided over by the Ministering Angel of Death (AKA Rachel Reeves). Dressed all in black like some latter day". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
